nodes.documentation:
LightSig Factory creates new instances of the multisig contract and triggers an event
for listeners to see the new contract.
nodes.name: LightSigFactory

nodes.documentation:
Function called by external addresses to create a new multisig contract
Caller must be whitelisted as an admin
nodes.name: createLightSig

nodes.documentation:
LightSig Factory creates new instances of the multisig contract and triggers an event
for listeners to see the new contract.
nodes.name: LightSigFactory

nodes.documentation:
Function called by external addresses to create a new multisig contract
Caller must be whitelisted as an admin
nodes.name: createLightSig

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addAdmin(address).notice: Add an admin to the list.  This should only be callable by the owner of the contract.

createLightSig(bytes32,address[],uint256.notice: Function called by external addresses to create a new multisig contract Caller must be whitelisted as an admin

isAdministrator(address).notice: Determine if the message sender is in the administrators list.

removeAdmin(address).notice: Remove an admin from the list.  This should only be callable by the owner of the contract.

userdoc.notice: LightSig Factory creates new instances of the multisig contract and triggers an event for listeners to see the new contract.
